abstract: Justice Dept accuses Dr Asad Qama of Ocala, Fla, one of nation's top-billing doctors, of performing unnecessary procedures on cardiac patients; he collected more than $18 million in payments from Medicare in 2012.
lead_paragraph: The lawsuits accuse Dr. Asad Qamar of billing Medicare for unnecessary operations, and paying kickbacks to patients by waiving their bills.

byline.original: By REED ABELSON and JULIE CRESWELL

snippet: The lawsuits accuse Dr. Asad Qamar of billing Medicare for unnecessary operations, and paying kickbacks to patients by waiving their bills.

headline.main: Justice Dept. Sues Doctor Paid Richly by Medicare
headline.print_headline: Justice Dept. Sues Doctor Paid Richly by Medicare
